data.description: Performs field inspection and issues the Operation Worthiness Certificate (SLO), followed by grid synchronization approval from PLN.
data.functional_role: final safety sign-off and grid entry

notes.informal_notes: The SLO process is usually predictable but can be delayed if construction deviates from submitted designs or if imported components lack final certification.
notes.symbolic_scaffold: SLO is the legal and symbolic marker of ‘grid readiness’ — the moment at which the project is treated as a real actor in the energy system.
notes.feedback_structure: If rejected, the inspector issues a corrective request. Feedback is formalized but brief.
failure_modes: Failed inspection due to grounding or enclosure noncompliance
Missing SNI documentation discovered at final stage
PLN delay in assigning synchronization window
